item.description:
• Please note you must also RSVP on the Event Website at http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6289964453 in order to obtain a ticket. Tickets are free. Here is some of the event info from the event website:

    This event is produced by Charles McEnerney (Principal of Layers Marketing + @wellroundedradi ) and Trish Fontanilla (http://about.me/trishofthetrade+ @trishofthetrade).

    In 2010, 2011, and 2012 we held Music 2.0 events. With 200+ attendees at each, they were terrific evenings, pulling together many of the music, tech, and event companies from Greater Boston. 
    For 2013, we're holding the event during the Together Festival (May 12-19, 2012) with new present, quick updates from some companies that presented in years past, and more time to meet friends new and old (read: networking!) and a chance for companies that are hiring to press the flesh with folks who are job hunting.

    Music 2.0: Tools + Tech for Musicians, Marketers, + Managers is Friday, May 17th at 328 Mass Ave in Central Square, Cambridge, Massachusetts from 6-9 PM.

    Presenters include: 
    • Bill Marx, Editor in Chief, The Arts Fuse • Erin Genett, Managing Interactive Producer, Online Learning, Berklee College of Music, Berklee Pulse • Dave Kusek, CEO, Create Biz• Ben Maitland-Lewis, CEO, Presskit.to• Eric Spicuzza, Director, Illumina Live• Mike Reilly, CEO, iMYurDj• Shannon Sadowski, Co-Founder, New Leaf Legal• Eva Papp Customer and Technical Support, Sales and Marketing, Spinitron

    Updates from past presenters include: 
    • Jack Kelly, CEO, Adva Mobile• Paul Kamp, Vice President, Business Development, Corporate Counsel, Backbone Radio Network • Jay Ziskrout, Founder and CEO, Charitable Checkout This year's great sponsor(s) include: • Notch Brewing more to come...maybe even you... 
    This year's event is again free! 
    Music 2.0 is a terrific event for: * musicians of every genre (rock, hip hop, jazz, folk, classical, electronic, opera, etc.) * marketing folks from venues, arts organizations,  etc. * managers and agents* investors* members of the media* promoters and presenters that work at venues, music organizations, etc.
item.name: Music 2.0: Tools + Tech for Musicians, Marketers + Managers: The 2013 Edition
